data.title: Famous Birthdays on July 13
data.meta_description: Famous birthdays for the 13th of July. See which celebrities, historical figures, scientists and criminals were born on July 13.
data.text:
Birthdays 1 - 200 of 205

Julius Caesar

Roman military and political leader [or July 12], born in Rome

John Dee, English alchemist, astrologer and mathematician, born in London, England (d. 1609)

Arthur Dee, English physician, born in Mortlake, London (d. 1651)

Clement X [Emilio Altieri], Italian Pope (1670-76), born in Rome (d. 1676)

Václav [Wenceslaus] Hollar, Bohemian-born etcher (depictioned17th century London), born in Prague, Bohemia (d. 1677)

Ferdinand III, King of Hungary & Bohemia and Holy Roman Emperor (1637-57), born in Graz, Duchy of Styria (d. 1657)

Robert Calder, Scottish British Royal Navy admiral (Seven Years' War; Napoleonic Wars), dubiously court-martialed after Battle of Cape Finisterre (1805), born in Elgin. Scotland (d. 1818) [Note: some sources cite birthplace as Kent, England; O.S. birthdate July 2]

Alexander Balashov, Russian general and statesman, born in Moscow (d. 1837)

Wilhelm Heinrich Wackenroder, German writer (Fantasies about Art), born in Berlin (d. 1798)

Caroline of Baden, Queen of Bavaria, born in Karlsruhe, Margraviate of Baden (d. 1841)

Pellegrino Rossi, Italian economist and politician, born in Carrara, Duchy of Massa and Carrara (now Italy) (d. 1848)

John Clare, English poet (Poems Descriptive of Rural Life and Scenery), born in Peterborough, Northamptonshire, England (d. 1864)

Alexandra Feodorovna

Empress of Russia and wife of Nicholas I, born in Charlottenburg Palace, Berlin

James Alexander Seddon, politician and lawyer (Confederate Secretary of War, 1862-65), born in Falmouth, Virginia (d. 1880)

Gustav Freytag, German writer and playwright (Debit and Credit), born in Kreuzburg, Silesia (d. 1895)

Nathan Bedford Forrest

American slave trader, Confederate lieutenant general and KKK Grand Wizard, born in Chapel Hill, Tennessee

Stanislao Cannizzaro, Italian chemist (Reaction of Cannizzaro), born in Palermo, Kingdom of the Two Sicilies (d. 1910)

Otto Wagner, Austrian architect and leading figure in the Vienna Secession movement, born in Vienna, Austria-Hungary (d. 1918)

George Bradley, American baseball pitcher (first no-hitter in MLB history 1876; NL ERA leader 1876), born in Reading, Pennsylvania (d. 1931)

Stewart Culin, American ethnographer, born in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania (d. 1929)

Sydney Webb, English socialist and economist (founded London School of Economics) and husband of Beatrice Webb, born in London, England (d. 1947)

Emma Mary Woolley, American educator and women's rights activist (President of Mount Holyoke College), born in South Norfolk, Connecticut (d. 1947)

John Jacob Astor IV

American business magnate, real estate developer (Astoria Hotel) and soldier (richest passenger aboard the Titanic), born in Rhinebeck, New York

Karl Erb, German opera and oratorio tenor, born in Ravensburg, Kingdom of Württemberg (d. 1958)

John Francis Larchet, Irish arranger (Irish national anthem), composer (By the Waters of Moyle), and musical director (Abbey Theatre - Dublin, 1908-35), born in Sandymount, Ireland (d. 1967)

Jean Murat, French actor (Eternal Rain, Carnival Flanders), born in Périgueux, Dordogne, France (d. 1968)

Louise Mountbatten, Queen of Sweden as consort of King Gustaf VI Adolf, born at Schloss Heiligenberg, Seeheim-Jugenheim, Germany (d. 1965)

1889 Stan Coveleski, American Baseball HOF pitcher (World Series 1920; AL ERA leader 1923, 25; AL strikeout leader 1920; Cleveland Indians, Washington Senators), born in Shamokin, Pennsylvania (d. 1984)

Franco Casavola, Italian composer, music theorist, and futurist, born in Modugno, Italy (d. 1955)

Isaak Babel, Russian writer, playwright and journalist (Red Calvary) [OS Jun 30], born in Odessa, Russian Empire (d. 1940)

Sidney Blackmer, American actor (played Ted Roosevelt in 7 movies, Rosemary's Baby), born in Salisbury, North Carolina (d. 1973)

Mordecai Ardon, Israeli painter, born in Tuchów, Austria-Hungary (d. 1992)

Julius Schreck, German Nazi military man (1st head of the SS), and confidant of Adolf Hitler, born in Munich, Kingdom of Bavaria (d. 1936)

1898 Martin David, German-Dutch law historian and papyrologist, born in Poznan, German Empire (d. 1986)

George Lewis [Joseph Zenon], American jazz clarinetist and bandleader (Bunk Johnson; Preservation Hall Jazz Band; "Burgundy Street Blues"), born in New Orleans, Louisiana (d. 1968)

Eric Portman, English actor (Naked Edge, Canterbury Tale), born in Yorkshire England (d. 1969)

Alfredo M. Santos, Philippine's first four-star General of the Armed Forces, World War II hero, born in Manila (d. 1990)

Harry Sosnik, American orchestra leader (Jack Carter Show, Your Hit Parade), born in Chicago, Illinois (d. 1996)

Charles H. Zimmerman, American aeronautical engineer (NACA, NASA), born in Olathe, Kansas (d. 1996)

David Branson, British piano prodigy, composer, musicologist, and visual artist, born in King's Lynn, Norfolk, England (d. 1987)

1909 Paul Constantinescu, Romanian composer (Ballad of the Outlaw for cello and orchestra), and pedagogue, born in Ploiești, Romania (d. 1963)

1909 Souphanouvong, President of Laos (1975-87), born in Louangphrabang, Laos (d. 1995)
